paper.abstract: The k-MAXCUT problem for undirected graphs G=(V, E) consists of finding a partition :[13],"that the number of edges with endpoints in two different sets Vi is maximized. We offer a new approach to this problem by showing :[13],"that the combinatorial notion of block designs can be used to algorithmically obtain partitions which achieve lower bounds for which until now only existence proofs were known.
